Have Completed 75 years of my Journey today. I have recorded My Mystical and Military experiences down in my latest book "Beyond Fear: A Personal Journey to Soma". Am grateful to my publisher Motilal Banarsidas for taking this volume out in time for my 75th Birhday. This deals with the two parallel paths in my life-one of a combat soldier- the external path of duty and grim battles and the second the equally ardous path of ones inner spiritual Evolution. Ultimately the Final path we have to traverse is up our own spines from The root chakra to the Shasrara chakra in the brain. I experienced its joy and ecstasy as The descent of The mystical Soma. Vedic Soma was prized both by the Aryan warriors and sages because it took away all fear and Pain. It made The sage ecstatic and joyful . My Gratitude To my wife Suneeta who shared this journey with me and to my Children Aditya and Purnima and their Spouses Nikki and Sandy. Above all are my real treasures- My Garndchildren Anahita and Samar who will carry Forward a Torch that goes back To the warrior Sage Parshram from my fathers side and to Guru Dronacharya from my Moms side. I bow in reverence before my parents and my AncestorsToday

In war /crisis you need a whole of the Govt approach that helps to synergise the CORE competencies of all organs and individuals of the state to achieve a common goal. Core COMPETENCIES are the key .it does not help if any single organ of the state seeks to go it alone and claim/try to handle everything by itself. The Union War book is the institutional memory of the state and lays down what each ministry has to do. It does not help when One ministry Oversteps its domain and tries to do the job of another. Lone wolf/ lone ranger responses militate against Synergy. it leads to stove piped and fragmented responses. Pak is the best example of this overreach by itsArmy.InIndia civilian supremacy is a GIVEN being a Democracy. Civilian control over armed forces is exercised by the MoD (and now also by NSA sectt In PMO). That is why veterans were surprised to see Secretary MeA take on Briefings on sensitive MILITARY operations involving high- intensity air strikes.These need high levels of domain expertise to be credible.The Secretary MeA is a very competent person but military ops are not his core competency. That is why Pak was able to impose its false narrative of victory in air ops in initial days by far slicker briefings and Power points done by Military officers. Things changed dramatically when (as per SOP) the DGMOs commenced briefing on miltary ops.We should not resort to adhocism in a crisis but go by Standard well tried SOPs. Before 1960 Indias MeA was handling the defense of Arunachal pradesh! Let us not return to that ludicurous situation. Military ops must be handeled by professionals and we must stick to core competencies in a crisis for best SYNERGY.

What is the aim of op Sindoor?To Decisively end Pak Terror. To that end we have hit 9 Paki Terror camps and killed 140 terrorists. Is that sufficient?No. What more?The real Paki terror managers are the Pak Army and ISI. One Paki Lt Gen attended the funeral of top terrorist Muddassar and laid a wreath on behalf of Pak Army Chief. A miliitary guard of honour was given and another wreath on behalf of Marriam Nawaz. Who are we trying to kid? Why this self deception? Instead of shouting this from the roof tops we are busy spreading this non state actor narrative.If we wont face the truth and act who else will do it on our behalf. Let India stand up and defend its citizen. We will have to take the bull by its horns.

The Indian armed forces have done a stellar job. In 4 days of kinetic combat we have destroyed 9 major Paki terror camps incl the HQ of LeT, JEM and HM at Muridke, Bhawalpur and Sialkot respectively. 140 terrorists have been killed including some 6 high value targets. Pakistan escalated by widening the conflict by an all out drone/missile offensive all along our western front aimed at some 15 Indian military targets including airfields. After initial probing attacks they launched a major assault with Fatah and Abdali missiles and ALCMs. Our integrated Air defense put up a stellar performance by shooting down almost 90%. In retaliation our Air force hit 11 major Paki Air fds including that of Rawalpindi (Chaklala), Sargodah and Skardu and knocked out 4 Paki AD radars. Two more days of such attacks would have crippled the Paki air force! The IAF and our AD grid shot down some 8 JF-17 Chinese jet fighters, one F-16, one J-10 and one Swedish AEW a/c/ Chinese AWAC. This was spectacular. We should have continued these strikes for min another day or two and then gone for a cease fire. Pak went crying to US begging to be saved. Marko Rubio spoke to Gen Munir. His DGMO spoke to our DGMO whining for a cease fire. Why the desperate hurry to accept it? Finally we agreed and within minutes Pak violated the cease fire all along the LC and IB over 2000 km front. This was not some local hot heads and loose canons. This was deliberate and pre-planned. The outrage in India is totally justified and I'm happy Op Sindoor is still on. So far things seem quiet but just one more transgression and India must complete the job with all force and violence at it's command.

I'm amazed by a strange tendency in some sections of our bureaucracy and media to play down the stellar achievements of our armed forces in this conflict — perhaps in the mistaken belief that it would provoke Pakistan !! For God sakes do they not know how hard they have been hit? They would like to deny it of course. If we decide to keep it a tightly guarded state secret, it would have a negative impact on national and military morale in a conflict. Of course nations do hide their losses in a conflict but hiding the enemies losses is a new one. I was gratified to see a return to common sense and standard SOPs with the DGMOs and equivalent of three services finally having a press briefing. It was a tonic to national morale. The Union War Book lays down what all arms of the govt have to do in war/conflict situations. It is the remit of the MoD (and now also NSA sectt) which controls our armed Forces and prepares them for war, to oversee ops thru Service chiefs and now CDS. We are a little confused to see MeA in control of day to day military ops briefings. The return to Standard wartime SOPs is a big relief. This is as close to full scale war as we have gotten since 1971. Let's not fool ourselves.
